# Government Tender Notice: Various Specialized Marine Training
## Solicitation #30003997
### Overview
Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) invites interested contractors to provide specialized marine training for current employees to become Search and Rescue (SAR) Coordinators for MRSC Quebec and JRCC Trenton.

## Background
The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) has an urgent need for training to address staffing shortages in MRSC Quebec and JRCC Trenton. This procurement strategy aims to provide the necessary training and certifications for internal employees to fill vacant SAR Coordinator positions.

## Objectives
- Provide specialized marine training accredited by Transport Canada.
- Acquire all required certifications for internal employees.
- Ensure adequate staffing levels at MRSC Quebec and JRCC Trenton.

## Requirements
The successful contractor will be responsible for providing:
- Various specialized training in maritime areas (e.g., watchkeeping mate certification, near coastal ship construction and stability, cargo training).
- Training facilities and equipment.
- Accommodations for students (optional).

## Conditions
- The contractor must be able to provide most of the training listed annually.
- Training must meet Transport Canada accreditation standards.

## Eligibility
Contractors must be registered in Canada and abide by Canadian laws and regulations.

## Tenders will be evaluated on the following criteria:
- Administrative and organizational capabilities.
- Technical expertise and capacity to provide specialized training.
- Price and payment conditions.

## Notes
- Deadlines and milestones must be met to ensure timely completion of training.
- The DFO will monitor contractor performance and adjust the procurement strategy as needed.

## Annex A: List of Required Training

Please see attached document for detailed information and requirements.
